newsitem.title: USA: Health Management named in lawsuit.
newsitem.headline: Health Management named in lawsuit.

text.p: A lawsuit has been filed against Health Management Systems Inc on behalf of purchasers of the company's common stock between Feb 27, 1996, and Feb 25, 1997, lawyers for the plaintiffs said Wednesday.

The suit alleges that the company and certain of its officers and directors made false statements to investors regarding the company's deteriorating financial condition while the defendants were selling more than $18.4 million worth of Health Management stock.
The suit, which seek class-action status, was filed yesterday in U.S. District Court here.

The law firm of Wolf Haldenstein Adler Freeman & Herz Llp said the plaintiffs seek to recover damages on behalf of class members. "We don't yet have a calculation of damages," said Jeffrey Smith, a partner at the firm.
No one from Health Management was available for comment.
